intro: Lagochilium obtusum, commonly known as the blunt-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and obtuse, contributing to its common name. Lagochilium obtusum is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
